text: They also celebrated the Feast of Tabernacles 3:4 That is, Sukkot, the autumn feast of pilgrimage to Jerusalem; also translated as the Feast of Booths or the Feast of Shelters and originally called the Feast of Ingathering (see Exodus 23:16 and Exodus 34:22). in accordance with what is written, and they offered burnt offerings daily based on the number prescribed for each day.
